title: Enlarge Home hero rotating logo element while preserving responsiveness and behavior

requirements.summary: Increase the Home hero rotating circular logo element to be visually >50% of the hero height on desktop while staying responsive and preventing overflow/clipping.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop breakpoints, the rotating circular element renders larger than half of the hero section height (visually dominant and clearly >50%).
On tablet and mobile breakpoints, the rotating circular element scales down responsively (no horizontal scroll, no content overlap, and no element clipping).
The element remains perfectly circular with the existing circular mask behavior intact, and the rotation/pause-on-hover behavior continues to work.

file_operations.description: Update the .rotating-logo-container sizing rules to increase its maximum size on desktop (e.g., raise the vh-based cap from ~45vh to >50vh, and adjust clamp values per breakpoint), while keeping max-width constraints for small screens to prevent horizontal scroll and preserving the circular mask via existing rounded-full/overflow-hidden styling.

Adjust the Home hero layout spacing around the rotating logo (if needed) to accommodate the larger circle without overlapping the headline/CTA and without triggering clipping within the hero sectionâ€™s overflow-hidden container; keep the existing rotating-logo-container/rotating-logo class usage so rotation and pause-on-hover behavior remain intact.
